Fields.DialogueText: Hello there, Capt'n! Fancy meeting you here!
Sigh. You know why I'm here, New Orleans.
Oh? Whatever do you mean, Capt'n?
Our Flag ID is "Negat-Afirm-Baker-Jig," not "Winter Tunic-Summer Tunic-Summer Trousers-Skivvies."
We're heading for port, so what's the harm of getting the laundry done before we got there?
The sooner all the chores are finished, the sooner you let the crew go ashore, you know.
They're clean. It's not like I'm airing out my dirty laundry.

Fields.MenuText: Dirty, no. But more conservative souls might consider your skivvies scandalous. And those were yours, I'm sure...
Please don't do that. I shudder to think what skeletons your closet might have, New Orleans...
Ha ha. Fun's over, New Orleans. Now fly the flags before I get a translation request.

Fields.DialogueText: Guilty as charged.
Not to worry, Capt'n, my locker is spotless. ... That kind of stuff I entrust to Davy Jones' Locker.
You don't know the International Code of Laundry? I see...
Seems it's time to take it down anyway. Looks like I jinxed us... we've got a storm brewing astern.
Morgana mist?
None other.
@BATTLE
Oh, hey. Cat sighting.
What's got your attention, Fuzz? A rat?
That's Fizz, Capt'n! Gin Fizz, not Fuzz! And Fizz, don't give me away here!
... New Orleans?
Looks like I've got to work on my CDD techniques...
CDD?
Cat Deception and Distraction.
Ah. I had heard cats were supposed to see spirits. Seeing a cat actually do it...
This is a first for me too, Capt'n.
So, what has you sneaking around, New Orleans?
I know the port assigned us a berth and I wanted to take a peek at the layout.
You could always just ask... It's on the chart... here.
I was afraid of that. Is it too late to get it changed?
I doubt it. Why?
None of the regulars will be close enough, and I'm supposed to host poker this time!

Fields.MenuText: "Regulars?" This is the first I've heard of it.
I doubt the port would be willing to play musical piers just to accommodate the gambling habits of you Belles.
Looks like you'll have to cede that job until another time.

Fields.DialogueText: Yup! The game table is a great place to bond and the only damage is empty purses and sore egos. Plus, there's nothing like watching a Destroyer eat a Battleship for lunch...
I figured you'd say that, but it was worth asking.
Yeah. You need to back me up, though. I'm going to get accused of being late on purpose if you don't.
So, are there any Belles I should avoid at a card table?
Some are good all-arounders, but most have a favorite game or two that they're good at. The trick is knowing who's good at what.
So who's good at poker?
The rule of thumb is any Belle who can stake a claim on the Mississippi River is a predator, Capt'n.
Including you?
*Wink*
Especially me. I'm the one masquerading as a harmless log.
@BATTLE
Let's see if those Morganas will call that bluff.
There has got to be an easier way...
An easier way to what? To find more card players? If this is about being stuck out by yourself...
A little bit. Even I get lonely sometimes.
You weren't too happy about the security gauntlet your "visitors" had to run either.
I didn't like my friends from port being raked over the coals just to come see me...
That's because most of them look like scoundrels.
Most of them are scoundrels... but that's beside the point.

Fields.MenuText: Maybe your reputation has preceded you?
You can't force people to like you.
I don't recall any clause in my birth certificate mandating that life would be fair.

Fields.DialogueText: Hee hee!
That hasn't stopped some folks in Europe and Asia from trying...
Yeah, it's not on my plaque either.
There's probably a simple, logical reason.
One that I'm going to look into. Right after we get rid of the incoming Morgana, that is...
@BATTLE
Slow day? You look bored.
Maybe I am... Ever get  bored and lonely, Capt'n?

Fields.MenuText: I actually like it quiet. Less gunfire, the better.
Gin Fizz isn't enough to keep you company?
I could use a little more action around here.

Fields.DialogueText: Stick with me and you'll develop a taste for gunfire... and for a lot of other dangerous things!
I'll cover her ears if you keep saying terrible things like that!
Well well! I had you pegged for the serious type, but you've got a wild side after all! Let me find some shot glasses...
Be serious, please.
I did some asking around. Scuttlebutt is that any port with Belles is perfectly good. Except...
Except?
The powers that be are under this absurd notion that if there are Belles in port, the Morganas are more likely to attack.
I see.
Well, I don't! That's ridiculous! The Morganas were here first and didn't sit around waiting for us to show up before they got nasty.
If they're so worried about Morganas, doesn't it make more sense to have us right there rather than be too late because we were on the way?
I'm sure there's plenty of pressure being applied diplomatically to get them to change their minds. We just have to be patient.
Well, maybe if the ship looked like just an old-fashioned, no-Belle, inanimate object - we might still be able to go to a fun port.
Sort of as a Trojan horse with defenders instead of invaders.
Your heart is in the right place, New Orleans, but even if it worked I don't think it would be a good idea. For one thing, if a Morgana showed up, you'd want to fight it off.
Of course, Capt'n!
But then you'd reveal that you're a Belle. That makes it look like the Morgana attacked because you were there. Just as they said would happen all along.
Hmmm...You have a point.
I'm still confused why you would need a disguise anyway. So long as Fizz doesn't give you away, couldn't you just stay hidden as a spirit?
Well, yeah, Capt'n... if I wanted to do it the easy way. But where's the fun in that?!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
Capt'n?
The look that says you've got something big on your mind.
Just trying to decide whether to talk to you about something or leave you in the dark, Capt'n.

Fields.MenuText: If you even have to ask yourself that...
Captains don't get to use "ignorance is bliss" as a defense for their court martial.
Out with it, New Orleans.

Fields.DialogueText: But if I leave you in the dark, you can disavow any knowledge!
We're not talking about anything that serious. ... Probably. ... Maybe?
Okay. But don't say I didn't warn you, Capt'n.
*ALARM*
Oh, hey... saved by Morganas!
You mean delayed by Morganas.
@BATTLE
I'm learning to be afraid of that look on your face.
What look would that be, Capt'n? What have I done to inspire such caution in my noble, benevolent commander?
Your gears have been turning a lot, New Orleans.
Pass me the lube oil, because they might start to grind.
If you don't open that mouth and start spilling what's on your mind--
Do you know the fastest way to get another Belle mad at you?

Fields.MenuText: Call her a boat?
Insult her abilities?
Do I know the fastest way to get a Belle mad at me? Have you even met me?

Fields.DialogueText: Certainly would do the trick with an American Belle. Even I'm NO Boat... I'm a ship. What I'm thinking of is even worse than that, though.
That would get some Belles worked up, but some have thicker skin than others. The right answer is guaranteed fighting words, Capt'n.
Sorry. I didn't mean to question your expertise. There's just an approach I've never known you to use.
The fastest way is to refer to a Belle by a sister's name. We know who's who, sight unseen... it's impossible to make that mistake.
I appreciate the lesson, but why? Did somebody do that to you?
No, but I had a thought. Maybe it's the same for Morganas...
And you suspect it works both ways - making disguises useless - if they know who you are no matter what?
Takes all the fun out of dressing up.
Okay. Aside from the fun factor.
Even that aside. My looks work like razzle dazzle, Capt'n. A Morgana may know who I am, but she can still have trouble believing her own eyes.
But the time that tactic might buy us... even that may not be enough to make a difference.
Still... what navy wouldn't come up with a strategy to intimidate and misdirect one another if they could pull off a convincing fake Morgana?
Capt'n, I'd be lying if I said ideas on how to make one had never crossed my mind. But that's as far as I've been willing to go. Now...
Let me think about this for a bit.
@BATTLE
A very short bit is all you get this time, Capt'n! Morganas incoming...
Mon Capitaine! A pleasure to see you!
New Orleans... speaking a bit of your other language today, I see.
Oui. I have a dossier for mademoiselle Orléans-Nouvelle.
Sigh. I like it better when you just act normal...
But do you REALLY, mon Capitaine?
So what's in the sheaf of papers there?
This, Capt'n? Just a dossier a few friends of mine cooked up.
Friends from the Protection Fleet, or friends from your network of scoundrels?
Taking the fun out of everything these days. Can't you tell I need that fun?

Fields.MenuText: Right. I forgot that you're in a mood.
Then I guess I need to work harder.
How is this different from any other day for you?

Fields.DialogueText: Don't put it like that, Capt'n.
With hope, you'll make some progress one day.
Point taken. Oh... the wound runs so deep...
Setting that aside, what's in the dossier?
All the pictures of Morganas that can be sent my way. Especially ones from the light cruiser and heavy cruiser classes.
Oh?
I'll be more convincing disguised as a Morgana close to my size.
We discussed this. Disguises are not going to be of any tactical use. Can you let this matter drop?
Then at least entertain me by looking at these photos and tell me how much prettier I am than all of these Morgana hags?
All hands to General Quarters!
@BATTLE
I get it!
*ALARM*
*sigh*
It never fails. Never around when you want them and they never fail to show up when you don't.
Morganas don't have a monopoly on that, New Orleans. That's the way most things are in life.
So we just need to do something that we don't want interrupted, right?
*wink*

Fields.MenuText: I take back what I said about you being serious.
If you want it to rain, plan a picnic.
So what do you have in mind?

Fields.DialogueText: You know what they say about ‘all work and no play', Capt'n.
You're close to the mark, Capt'n!
I'm glad you asked, Capt'n!
As we speak, the galley is making jambalaya for lunch. What Morgana wouldn't want to deny a hard-working crew a taste of home cooking?
I doubt that's going to tempt fate enough to--
Morgana sighted!
Never thought I'd ever be grateful for that report! Come closer, Uglies, and give my guns something to do!
@BATTLE
Hey, Capt'n, wanna join your favorite Belle in the darkroom?
I'll do what I always do. Wait for your explanation instead of presuming something unprofessional, New Orleans.
I like how your mind works... Well, some of it, anyways.
You misunderstand, Capt'n. My camera captured quite the photo shoot during that last battle.

Fields.MenuText: So we go into a dark room together and see what develops?
Photographs to study our enemy and learn more about them. I like that!
Photojournalism to keep everybody informed of the war effort? A worthy cause.

Fields.DialogueText: Now you're making this fun, Capt'n! I knew you'd help me shake some of this boredom.
I needed something to do...
Not exactly what I had in mind...
I don't know exactly what I'll get when I develop these pictures, but if nothing else it'll give me something to do.
I could use the distraction from supply paperwork and performance evaluations. Let's do it.
Yep!
I wonder if any of these would make good pinup posters...
@BATTLE
It was a joke, Capt'n! A joke!
*ALARM*
I've jotted down all the extra details I could think of from studying the photos I took.
The ones you took of the Morganas in combat?
Yes, Capt'n!
Find anything interesting?
No, Capt'n!

Fields.MenuText: Are you about to lose your mind?
Nothing ventured, nothing gained.
It can't be that bad.

Fields.DialogueText: The road from here to insanity might be a long one, but it feels like I'm in a fast car on that road!
At least it did keep me busy for a little while, that's true.
YES IT IS!
I thought the photos would keep me busy, and what I'd really hoped for was a plan.
A plan?
I had hopes, Capt'n. Hopes that some little detail or insight from the photos might lead to an idea, and idea to a plan, and a plan to--
To battle stations!
@BATTLE
All finished?
Yes, Capt'n!
Exactly, Capt'n! You understand how bored I--
No, no, New Orleans. I mean, get to battle stations. We've got Morganas on the horizon!
The humanity!
What are you doing, New Orleans?
Oh Capt'n! This is such a waste! It's a TRAGEDY! I was pouring some milk for Fizz, you see...
I get it. Spilled milk. Isn't it supposed to be "crying over spilt milk"?
Oh yeah, that's right... crying! Thanks, Capt'n!
*Sob* So pure...*sob* so fresh...*sniffle*
I might be nitpicking here, but I don't think you get to cry over spilt milk if it ends up in a saucer for Fizz.
(grin) I can still work with that... let's see...
*Sob* Poor, poor milk... to be shed so, yet no one weeps for you! *Sob*

Fields.MenuText: Just don't "shed" too much, New Orleans. It's not good for cats.
If you help making some tears, I can help... Any spilt milk comes out of the amount for your Bourbon Milk Punch.
(clap clap clap) Bravo! Bravo!

Fields.DialogueText: Really? I didn't know that.
But.... Noo! Not that!!
Thank you... (bows) Thank you..
How long do I have before you ask for an explanation.
Another minute or two, at the most.
Morganas come first, though. Right?
@BATTLE
So about that explanation...
Well, I've been trying to figure out what attracts Morganas. What's the magnet?
A magnet?
Right. Opposites attract with magnets. But if that were true here, Morganas and I should be joined at the hip. I'm nothing like one of them, right?

Fields.MenuText: Not in the least.
Well, Belles and Morganas do have a few similarities that are impossible to ignore...
You attached to a Morgana. Now there's a scary image...

Fields.DialogueText: Flattery will get you everywhere with me, Capt'n.
Eh, you just had to ruin the point I was trying to make...
Being joined at the hip with a more agreeable creature, however...
But after looking at the photos, and thinking about what makes Morganas tick... I had to do more research.
I've heard of crazier things.
I've done crazier things, Capt'n. Many of them.
You were getting back to your point, before you were distracted... by yourself?
Yeah.
Wait. What was I saying? I lost my train of thought.
@BATTLE
Can we pretend that we're two professionals, New Orleans?
Very funny, New Orleans.
*ALARM*
Time for a drink, Capt'n? Seems like the whole crew is having one.
The non-Fleet portion of the Navy had fits that you're not still "dry" like they are, so you've been ordered to lose the booze again while out to sea.
And before you restock any hidden stashes, remember that Fizz knows where you go ... and I can follow Fizz.
Capt'n. I hope you know the only way you're going to make that stick is to make it an ironclad order.

Fields.MenuText: Sorry. I'm not too keen on getting on the US Navy's bad side.
Rules are rules, New Orleans. I'm not above them and you aren't either.
Do you think other Belles are this much of a handful?

Fields.DialogueText: (chuckle)
... Wait. What?
I was kidding. If anything, the US Navy sees our rations as deserved rewards for our Morgana patrols.
Don't do that to me, Capt'n! I may be made of stern stuff, but... if anyone else overheard that and didn't stick around for the punchline...
Remember how I saw the crew drinking like it was closing time? They'll be sloshed if we don't stop them...
Right. I'll go make an announcement.
@BATTLE
You really haven't heard, have you?
Gulp! Heard what?
Just a little joke.
You can close your mouth now. Do you need help getting your jaw off the deck?
*ALARM*
Still feeling bored? I can't tell if you're moping or if you're working on your acting.
I'm through the worst of my funk, Capt'n. And I owe some of that to your sense of humor.
Hearing that is a relief. I thought my prank, telling you the fleet was going dry, might do more harm than good.
I also got a few laughs developing more photos of the Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: Do they make funny faces when we blast them?
Maybe you should find a more productive hobby.
Take some pictures of Fizz instead.

Fields.DialogueText: You know it! Hee hee hee! I wonder if--
Oh, please, my dear. You've seen enough of my hobbies. Any of them ever seem productive to you? In fact, I--
If Fizz would ever hold still for a photo, I'd--
Something wrong?
I just had an idea...
It must be a big idea, if it made you shut your mouth for a few seconds.
*grin*
Care to explain this idea before it--
Wait! Sssh! The idea is still rolling around in my head. I don't want to lose it...
*ALARM*
I'll meet you there, Capt'n. First I've gotta get this camera to our pilot!
@BATTLE
Wrong way, New Orleans. We've got to get to the bridge!
@BATTLE
Olly, olly, oxen free...
You called?

Fields.MenuText: It's not a toy, New Orleans.
So... the camera finally went overboard?
I can stare right back at you as long as I need to, NO Boat.

Fields.DialogueText: In my hands, it makes for a fun time! (wink) A shame that camera's not in my hands, though.
Hmm... Good guess! It did leave the ship, but it's coming back.
And what do you see when you look at me, Capt'n? That's the real question.
Explain before we die of old age, please.
Well, you recall that I took pictures of the Morganas. For fun, but also for a little research.
Right.
And then you said something that got me thinking... so I gave the camera to one of our pilots.
Please tell me the camera's not in a pawn shop by now.
Relax, Cap. I just asked Williams to take a few photos during combat.
Ahem! New Orleans... we've got aerial photos of Morganas. We've got surface photos of Morganas. What difference--
Not photos of Morganas. Photos of me. Now I'm just tapping my foot waiting to get the camera back...
Relentless, aren't they? Morganas should learn that it's ugly to be so pushy.
Let's push back!
Mmm hmm!
I want to know when that camera is coming back. It's an expensive piece of equipment, you know.
He's got a discerning eye. I should know, considering how often I catch him looking at my--
Have you reached a decision?
I have. I have decided...

Fields.MenuText: Agreed. These photos of you during combat are glorious.
Seems like a fair reward for risking his life, flying a floatplane around in a gunfight to take vanity pictures of you.
Don't risk our crew or assets like that without my approval, New Orleans.

Fields.DialogueText: He got my good side. And my other good side. Ha!
Williams can handle himself. He has great moves... (wink)
Forgiveness is so much easier than permission, Capt'n...
*ALARM*
I have decided that Williams truly deserved that big wet kiss for taking these photos.
Work fast, or these photos will be the only evidence of how pretty you were.
Careful, Capt'n! We need to protect the film before we go. It'd be a damn shame to spoil all of this beauty...
@BATTLE
So modest.
Hee hee hee!
I've got fast hands, Capt'n. We'll be in the bridge long before the Morganas can give us a gunsmoke makeover!
Huh.
You look impressed, Capt'n.
I... guess that's a viable adjective. Sure.
So. That's quite the mountain of supplies we're taking on this time. Especially the paint.
I have my needs, Capt'n.

Fields.MenuText: But why do we need so much paint?
Needs which I would like to understand.
You'll hurt your back carrying so much. Or, your... uh... your keel or whatever.

Fields.DialogueText: Must I really spell it out?
But I want you to be surprised, Capt'n!
Still trying to figure out my anatomy, Capt'n? All you have to do for a free lesson is ask nicely... (wink)
Don't worry, Capt'n. It may not look like much now, but when I'm through, the Brooklyn Naval Yard wouldn't recognise my hull.
Just seems like you've got an ambitious project, and I'm still in the dark.
@BATTLE
I have a reason for all this paint, Cap. I promise.
*ALARM*
Capt'n, I've got a requisition form for your signature. Pretty please?
And you'd prefer that I sign without reading it too closely?
Good! You're learning to read my mind. Our bond of friendship and camaraderie is truly paying dividends.

Fields.MenuText: Sounds logical to me. I guess this requisition is all in order.
I'm sure you have ways of compelling the supply officer's approval in a shady scheme.
Not so fast.

Fields.DialogueText: Yes... yes... now sign the paperwork... yes...
Oh! Your suspicion wounds me, Capt'n! (swoon)
Awww... Don't be such a spoil sport.
I'm looking this over closely...
@BATTLE
Let me reach for my pen, to make you think you're getting your way...
... while I quickly scan the paperwork to see-- Oh. Wait a minute. Did the supply department see this yet?
I have all of the required signatures, so they must have!
Mmm hmm...
I can't find where you hid the frivolous expenses that I'm sure you've got planned in here.
Sounds to me like your heart is at ease, then.
Not exactly. If anything, I'm more suspicious than ever. After you got all of that paint, I'm wondering what else you're up to.
Then trust me. You know I would never take an action to hurt this ship or crew.
*ALARM*
Unlike certain ugly forces of evil...
The paint was one thing. Now you've got fog machines?! Do you really think these fog machines are going to work?
By themselves, no. But a Morgana without mist is too suspicious and this is the closest I can come to the real thing.
So you're trying to paint yourself up and blow some fog around to look like a Morgana? I thought we agreed that disguises were a bad idea.
Just because you said something doesn't mean we agreed, Capt'n.

Fields.MenuText: Then I guess you can explain everything at Captain's Mast.
Spell it out for me, New Orleans.
Fight the Morganas. Not your captain.

Fields.DialogueText: Hey! Whoa whoa whoa, no need for threats!
Patience, Capt'n.
Right...
So, my thinking goes like this. If we--
*ALARM*
Want me to keep going, or should we race each other to the bridge?
I just can't help but think about one thing.
Which is?
How ugly it will be when a Morgana shell hits all these cans of paint. Our deck would look like...
A fun splash of color? But I do see your point, Capt'n. I'll be sure to bob and weave during the fight.
@BATTLE
Watch your step, Capt'n. There are open paint cans over here.
When you proposed this, It didn't occur to me that the whole ship was going to be involved...
I am committing myself completely to this experiment, Capt'n.
Sometimes I think you should be committed.
Hee hee hee!

Fields.MenuText: You really think you can imitate a Morgana?
Did those photos make you self-conscious? You're a fine looking ship, New Orleans.
This is going to look really cool!

Fields.DialogueText: Maybe, maybe not.
So sweet of you to say, Capt'n! But moi, self-conscious? Perish the thought!
That it will, but my plan is a little more than that.
All of that had me thinking about how Belles and Morganas really "see" each other.
Or how you "sense" each other, right? Isn't that more accurate to say?
Not to worry, Capt'n. None of this is permanent. We can go from Charon's gondola to member of the first Fleet Week in two shakes of a lamb's tail.
(wink) ... And this lamb can shake her tail pretty quick.
@BATTLE
All of this paint, and now fog machines...
The Morgana photos, the photos of me, even Fizz...
What about Gin Fizz?
Even when I try to hide, that cat can find me anywhere!
It is, but the visuals matter, too. I don't know what the paint and smoke will do, exactly, but I'm willing to try it out.
Are you willing to clean off all of that paint when your experiment is done?
*ALARM*
I wish you hadn't talked me into doing the final prep so far out.
There was no helping it on a job this big, Capt'n. If anyone saw us before we were ready, we'd lose the element of surprise.

Fields.MenuText: You haven't told the other Belles about your plan?
I still don't think this paint job and smoke is going to do much.
Morganas will still sense us, no matter what we look like.

Fields.DialogueText: If I tell my sisters everything, they'll learn all my tricks. How will I beat them at poker if I don't keep a few cards up my sleeve?
Maybe, maybe not. Don't you want to find out, though?
That's what the experiment is all about, Capt'n.
I will remind you, NO Boat, that we're doing this only because you promised me two things.
Remind me again? (bats eyelashes)
The crew agreed without coercion.
Check.
@BATTLE
And this paint WILL wash off.
Hmm... Probably check. Hee hee hee!
New Orleans...
*ALARM*
The crew is really slapping on the paint, aren't they? I'm so proud of 'em!
The paint's hardly dry, but here comes our first customer!
Prepare to engage the enemy!
@BATTLE
All right, New Orleans - what's your assessment? Was there anything different about that fight?

Fields.MenuText: Did they hesitate at all before they started shooting?
Did your Morgana paint job and fake mist make them angry?
I don't think it made any difference.

Fields.DialogueText: You saw for your self. If they did hesitate, it wasn't for long.
Hard to say. They're always in such a foul mood as it is.
Well... I'm not sure...
I know what you're going to say, Capt'n! But please, hear me out.
Don't I just love being so predictable...
That's my point! Even if we don't have hard data, at least we're unpredictable.
How do you mean, Capt'n?
All right. I'm not convinced all of the time, the crew pulling extra work for paint detail, and all the money spent on paint and fog machines is quite worth it yet, but...
... but you're saying yes to continuing the experiment! No need to say it, Capt'n. I got your message loud and clear from that look on your face.
And your posture. Yep, the way you tap your foot and stand there with your hands on your hips. Yes... everything about it says you're pleased and in accord!
Don't push your luck too far, New Orleans.
The Morganas keep circling. Are the fog machines working?
See for yourself, Capt'n. We're making a fair amount of "Morgana Mist" with those things. Hey!
Hey, what?
Do you think that'd made a good name for a cocktail? "Morgana Mist"...

Fields.MenuText: Sounds terrible. What would you put in it? Rotten milk and a splash of diesel fuel?
I'd rather taste a Bourbon Belle.
I might have to hold my nose while drinking it, but I'd try anything.

Fields.DialogueText: Sailors will drink stranger things, as long as it gets a buzz. Ever heard of torpedo juice? Whoo!
Play your cards right, and maybe you will! Hee hee hee! Ahem. Sorry, Capt'n. Unprofessional.
That's the "spirit"! Get it? Spirit? Hee hee hee!
I got it.
Let me find a pencil. I hate to let a good idea go to waste. Or a good drink, for that matter.
Make it fast. Those Morganas decided to belly up to the bar.
Let's pour 'em a shot they won't soon forget!
@BATTLE
We've seen a few battles with this crazy Morgana paint scheme. Any useful data?
Eh...
Admitting defeat?
I wouldn't call it defeat, but I'll admit that I still don't have the answers I wanted.

Fields.MenuText: Should've known it was a waste of time and money.
Don't be discouraged. It was worth a shot.
Maybe if we tried a different paint scheme, a little more "mist" from the fog machines...

Fields.DialogueText: Not so fast...
I'll try anything once, Capt'n. And then a few more times, just to make sure! Still, I have to say...
I like your optimism, Capt'n. All the same...
Maybe I was a little too optimistic with my expectations.
You got serious all of a sudden. I didn't mean to take the wind from your sails like that.
Was it a worthy endeavor? I say yes. I had hoped that maybe I could learn more about how Belles and Morganas sense each other.
And the way Gin Fizz seems to sniff me out, no matter how I hide...
So maybe smell has something to do with it?
Maybe. Maybe there's more to the ways of the animal kingdom than just sight and sound. Still, with all the paint fumes I'm giving off, who can say?
It might take a lot more experimentation to find out exactly how it works.
And maybe it's none of those things, Capt'n. Maybe something supernatural about Belles and Morganas transcends all of it.
You keep grouping Belles and Morganas together. Is that on purpose?
Can't deny that maybe I've got more in common with a Morgana than I do with a stray cat - no matter how much that idea makes me shudder and reach for a stiff drink.
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
You weren't kidding when you said you'd have the hull back to normal in no time.
Just a little cove for calm water and a lot of bug juice from the galley.
Thanks for taking care of it so fast. HQ was asking a lot of questions, and I was running out of evasive answers.
So, what's the damage?
What do you mean?
Do they think I was crazy to try all of that paint and smoke?

Fields.MenuText: Maybe a little bit...
They do, and I agree with 'em.
Who cares what they think?

Fields.DialogueText: Ah, well. At least I didn't have to hide from a detail of MP's coming for me with a straitjacket.
Not you, Capt'n! I know I push the limits, but I don't ever want to lose your trust.
I care a little bit, if I'm honest.
You've still got my trust, New Orleans. Actually, I think you're brilliant.
That's a relief. Now, tell me how brilliant you think I am?
You took some insights, came up with some big ideas, and you had the courage to try them out.
You painted yourself to look like a Morgana, and it wasn't just for a joke. You were trying to explore something that might help us win the war.
Oh... I was really something, wasn't I? And I'd do it again, too!
Without a doubt.
And I had such a lovely captain, supporting me and trusting me - even when I make that hard to do, sometimes...
*Ahem* Just sometimes?!
Stop it, Capt'n. I'm trying to tell you what a great friend you are to me.
Thanks, New Orleans. Just one thing.
Name it, Capt'n!
A real friend would bring a couple of drinks around for us to enjoy after a job well done.
Bourbon Milk Punch? Or maybe you'd like to try a "Morgana Mist"? Hee hee hee!
Dealer's choice, New Orleans. Any drink suits me, if I'm drinking it with you.
Not evasive enough for those Morganas headed our way!
@BATTLE
